required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Navi-Star Thermo-Cool Catheter For Ablation of Atrial Fibrillation
clinical_study.official_title: Navi-Star Thermo-Cool Catheter For Ablation of Atrial Fibrillation

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study is to demonstrate that the NAVI-STAR THERMO-COOL catheter can be used to safely and effectively reduce symptomatic episodes of paroxysmal atrial fibrillation in patients with frequent (>3 episodes/month) or infrequent <3 episodes/month)atrial fibrillation resistant to at least one Class I or Class III antiarrhythmic drug.

primary_outcome.description: Outcome is determined by recurrence of atrial tachyarrhythmia in participants. Outcome is measured by any atrial tachyarrhythmias recorded by 12-lead ECGs, Holter monitoring or event monitoring. Recurrence of atrial tachyarrhythmia is also measured by symptoms reported by patients. Symptoms include palpitations, dizziness, dyspnea and any AF-related symptoms that existed before AF ablation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Total Number of Significant Ablation Procedure Related Complications
secondary_outcome.description: Any complication directly related to the ablation procedure was included. These complications included pericardial effusion, cardiac tamponade, excessive bleeding requiring transfusion, phrenic nerve injury, atrio-esophageal fistula, vascular access complications, myocardial infarction and stroke.

arm_group.description: This study contains only one arm, which is GP ablation + PV antrum isolation. The intervention (GP ablation + PV isolation) was performed using ThermoCool Navistar catheters in all patients

intervention.description: All patients underwent GP ablation and PV isolation using the NaviStar ThermoCool ablation catheter

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Age greater or equal to 18 years
2. At least one documented episode of atrial fibrillation (AF) within the previous 6 months.
3. Failure of at least one antiarrhythmic drug (Class I or III) defined as recurrence of AF or adverse effect.
4. Informed consent obtained.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Left atrial thrombus
2. Acute myocardial infarction within eight (8) weeks
3. Atriotomy within eight (8) weeks
4. Decompensated heart failure (unless the AF is thought to be a significant etiologic factor and AF ablation is clinically indicated)
5. Pregnancy
6. Ablation in a pulmonary vein within 4 months.
7. Occurrence of perforation during an ablation procedure performed less than two months prior to the planned ablation date.
8. Significant congenital anomaly or medical problem that, in the opinion of the investigator, would preclude enrollment in the study.
9. Enrolled in an investigational study evaluating another device or drug
10. Unwilling to participate in the study or unavailable for follow-up visits.
11. Incarcerated

facility.name: University of Oklahoma Health Sciences Center

group.title: GP Ablation + PV Isolation
group.description: All patients in this study received pulmonary vein isolation (PVI) and ganglionated plexi (GP) ablation to treat paroxysmal AF

participants_list.participants: A total of 119 enrolled and 112 underwent the ablation procedure;

group.title: PV Isolation + GP Ablation
group.description: All patients received pulmonary vein antrum isolation (PV isolation) and ablation of the major atrial ganglionated plexi (superior left GP, inferior left GP, anterior right GP and inferior right GP). Ganglionated plexi (GP) were identified by delivering high-frequency stimulation (20 Hz) from the ablation catheter. If vagal response (AV block) was initiated by stimulation, that site was counted as a GP site and was then ablated.

outcome.title: Atrial Tachyarrhythmia Recurrence in Participants
outcome.description: Outcome is determined by recurrence of atrial tachyarrhythmia in participants. Outcome is measured by any atrial tachyarrhythmias recorded by 12-lead ECGs, Holter monitoring or event monitoring. Recurrence of atrial tachyarrhythmia is also measured by symptoms reported by patients. Symptoms include palpitations, dizziness, dyspnea and any AF-related symptoms that existed before AF ablation.
outcome.population: all patients referred for paroxysmal AF ablation between 1-2004 and 12-2005 were included

group.title: GP Ablation + PV Isolation)
group.description: All patients received high-frequency stimulation (20 Hz) to the presumed GP site to elicit a vagal response (AV block). After all GP sites were ablated, all patients underwent circumferential PV isolation.

measure.title: Atrial Tachyarrhythmia Recurrence in Participants
measure.description: Outcome is determined by recurrence of atrial tachyarrhythmia in participants. Outcome is measured by any atrial tachyarrhythmias recorded by 12-lead ECGs, Holter monitoring or event monitoring. Recurrence of atrial tachyarrhythmia is also measured by symptoms reported by patients. Symptoms include palpitations, dizziness, dyspnea and any AF-related symptoms that existed before AF ablation.
measure.population: all patients referred for paroxysmal AF ablation between 1-2004 and 12-2005 were included

outcome.title: Total Number of Significant Ablation Procedure Related Complications
outcome.description: Any complication directly related to the ablation procedure was included. These complications included pericardial effusion, cardiac tamponade, excessive bleeding requiring transfusion, phrenic nerve injury, atrio-esophageal fistula, vascular access complications, myocardial infarction and stroke.

group.title: Experimental Arm (GP Ablation + PV Antrum Isolation)
group.description: All patients received high-frequency stimulation (20 Hz) to the presumed GP site to elicit a vagal response (AV block). After all GP sites were ablated, all patients underwent circumferential PV isolation.

measure.title: Total Number of Significant Ablation Procedure Related Complications
measure.description: Any complication directly related to the ablation procedure was included. These complications included pericardial effusion, cardiac tamponade, excessive bleeding requiring transfusion, phrenic nerve injury, atrio-esophageal fistula, vascular access complications, myocardial infarction and stroke.

reported_events.time_frame: The adverse effects were collected within the 1st year after ablation.

group.title: Experimental Arm (GP Ablation + PV Antrum Isolation)
group.description: All patients received high-frequency stimulation (20 Hz) to the presumed GP site to elicit a vagal response (AV block). After all GP sites were ablated, all patients underwent circumferential PV isolation.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Sunny Po, MD., Study Principal Investigator
